paper.title: Pseudorandom generators from one-way functions: a simple construction for any hardness

author.org: Department of Computer Science, ETH Zurich, Zurich

paper.abstract: In a seminal paper, Hastad, Impagliazzo, Levin, and Luby showed that pseudorandom generators exist if and only if one-way functions exist. The construction they propose to obtain a pseudorandom generator from an n-bit one-way function uses $\mathcal{O}(n^8)$ random bits in the input (which is the most important complexity measure of such a construction). In this work we study how much this can be reduced if the one-way function satisfies a stronger security requirement.
